intro: Acrostichum potentillifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species in both ecological and horticultural contexts.
